alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 23 at 12:02PM AKST until February 24 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Freezing rain mixing in with the snow this morning. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Ice accumulation of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperature cooling with blizzard conditions redeveloping by early Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
